pr_title: Show error alert when resource not available from WCP.

timeline.message: Show error alert when resource not available from WCP.

timeline.bodyText: Do these have to be nullable? Can we just default to the values in defaultError?
timeline.author: nikklassen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,47 @@
+//  Copyright 2020 Google LLC
+//
+//  Use of this source code is governed by an MIT-style
+//  license that can be found in the LICENSE file or at
+//  https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT.
+
+import Foundation
+
+protocol ErrorPresentable: Error {
+  var title: String? { get }
+  var message: String? { get }
+}
+
+struct ApiError: ErrorPresentable {
+
+  // MARK: - Properties
+  var title: String?

replies.bodyText: Yes, this should be optional/nullable properties. This follows the same Apple design guidelines as their initializers take title and message as optional values and they handle it over there while presenting the alerts. So to avoid checks of nil values, it's good to have the same design.
replies.author: tushar-boston
